alert.note: Alert for Cabo Rojo; Hormigueros; Mayaguez (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 27 at 6:21PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and increased streamflow is occurring or expected to begin shortly along Rio Guanajibo, which has reached flood stage. * WHERE...Cabo Rojo, Hormigueros and Mayaguez. * WHEN...Until midnight AST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 515 PM AST, River gauge reports indicated that Rio Guanajibo has surpassed flood stage level of 20 feet, now at 20.07 feet and increasing. - Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen within Guanajibo`s river basin. - Flooding is already occurring or expected to begin shortly in the warned area, affecting roads PR-114, PR-309, and PR-347. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
